page.title: 02Agricultural outputs
page.content: The outputs of the farms in this area are milk, wool and meat. The milk is collected by Milk Marketing Board bulk tankers daily and taken to Carlisle and Aspatria for manufacture into cheese or butter. The wool is collected by the Wool Marketing Board and distributed to mills throughout the country. The sheep that have been fattened or are too old to breed can be sold weekly at Cockermouth and Penrith auctions. Beef cattle are sold weekly at Penrith and at Cockermouth there are two auctions one weekly and the other every fortnight. Surplus fodder crops, especially grasses, are sold weekly at Carlisle's auction mart.
